articles.headline: F.T.C. Backs Plan to Honor Privacy of Online Users
articles.snippet: The framework would let consumers decide if they wanted Web sites and advertisers to track them.
articles.abstract: The framework would let consumers decide if they wanted Web sites and advertisers to track them.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  Signaling a sea change in the debate over Internet privacy, the government’s top consumer protection agency on Wednesday advocated a plan that would let consumers choose whether they want their Internet browsing and buying habits monitored.
articles.byline: By Edward Wyatt and Tanzina Vega

articles.headline: U.S. Halts Plan to Drill in Eastern Gulf
articles.snippet: A decision to allow offshore oil drilling in the eastern Gulf of Mexico and along the Atlantic Coast will be rescinded.
articles.abstract: A decision to allow offshore oil drilling in the eastern Gulf of Mexico and along the Atlantic Coast will be rescinded.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  The Obama administration announced on Wednesday that it had rescinded its decision to expand offshore oil exploration into the eastern Gulf of Mexico and along the Atlantic Coast because of weaknesses in federal regulation revealed by the BP oil spill.
articles.byline: By John M. Broder and Clifford Krauss

articles.headline: Fed Documents Breadth of Emergency Measures
articles.snippet: Efforts to help stabilize the markets during the financial crisis reached far beyond Wall Street, new data show.
articles.abstract: Efforts to help stabilize the markets during the financial crisis reached far beyond Wall Street, new data show.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  As financial markets shuddered and then nearly imploded in 2008, the Federal Reserve opened its vault to the world on a scope much wider and deeper than previously disclosed.
articles.byline: By Sewell Chan and Jo Craven McGinty

articles.headline: Worries About Italy and Belgium in Euro Zone
articles.snippet: Few people think the countries will default, but they must muster the political cohesion needed to assure markets that they can reduce their debt.
articles.abstract: Few people think the countries will default, but they must muster the political cohesion needed to assure markets that they can reduce their debt.
articles.lead_paragraph: Throughout Europe’s financial crisis, Italy and Belgium have managed to avoid being one of the countries that keep people awake at night.

articles.headline: Below Surface, U.S. Has Dim View of Putin and Russia
articles.snippet: The United States harbors a low view of the Russian leaders and little hope that Russia will become more democratic or reliable.
articles.abstract: The United States harbors a low view of the Russian leaders and little hope that Russia will become more democratic or reliable.
articles.lead_paragraph: Early in 2009, as recession rippled around the world, the United States Embassy in Moscow sent to Washington a cable summarizing whispers within Russia’s political class. Prime Minister Vladimir V. Putin, the rumors said, often did not show up at his office.

articles.headline: Web to TV: New Gadget With Glitches
articles.snippet: It seemed like a good idea: Orb TV would fetch any Web TV show over your wireless network and send it to your TV set. But after the concept came the execution.
articles.abstract: It seemed like a good idea: Orb TV would fetch any Web TV show over your wireless network and send it to your TV set. But after the concept came the execution.
articles.lead_paragraph: How’s this for a miracle scenario?

articles.headline: Enforcement Takes On a Softer Side in China
articles.snippet: A district in China has supplemented its urban street police with 13 women, to give the force a softer side.
articles.abstract: A district in China has supplemented its urban street police with 13 women, to give the force a softer side.
articles.lead_paragraph: CHENGDU, China  Like an urban drill sergeant, Tang Shenbin paced on a city square, sternly inspecting his nervous charges, issuing sotto voce commands with military authority. He wanted the female members of chengguan  China’s burly enforcers of urban order, feared and despised for their capricious crackdowns and penchant for violence  to convey a certain impression to a clutch of onlookers.

articles.headline: A Brash Bettor Stumbles
articles.snippet: Federal authorities are examining whether Philip Falcone used the hedge fund Harbinger Capital as a piggy bank to pay an income tax bill.
articles.abstract: Federal authorities are examining whether Philip Falcone used the hedge fund Harbinger Capital as a piggy bank to pay an income tax bill.
articles.lead_paragraph: Shortly after noon on Nov. 14, a Russian-made rocket blasted off from Baikonur Cosmodrome, the Soviet-era launch site that catapulted Sputnik 1 into orbit.
articles.byline: By Julie Creswell and Azam Ahmed

articles.headline: Google Acts to Demote Distasteful Web Sellers
articles.snippet: The search engine is trying to stop an online merchant from using tricks to get viewer hits.
articles.abstract: The search engine is trying to stop an online merchant from using tricks to get viewer hits.
articles.lead_paragraph: Google announced on Wednesday that it had changed the way it ranks search results so that unscrupulous merchants would find it harder to appear prominently in searches.

articles.headline: Obesity Surgery May Become Option for Many More
articles.snippet: Food and Drug Administration advisers will consider a request by a pharmaceutical company to lower how obese someone must be to qualify for surgery using its device.
articles.abstract: Food and Drug Administration advisers will consider a request by a pharmaceutical company to lower how obese someone must be to qualify for surgery using its device.
articles.lead_paragraph: Weight-loss surgery, once a last resort for extremely overweight people, may soon become an option for those who are less heavy.

articles.headline: Opponents Take Aim at Limited Health Plans
articles.snippet: Insurers are defending a federal waiver that preserves limited benefit plans under the new health insurance law.
articles.abstract: Insurers are defending a federal waiver that preserves limited benefit plans under the new health insurance law.
articles.lead_paragraph: Maybe something isn’t always better than nothing.

articles.headline: Europe Bank Extends Emergency Support
articles.snippet: The European Central Bank said it would delay plans to withdraw emergency measures, but investors had hoped for a stronger display of support.
articles.abstract: The European Central Bank said it would delay plans to withdraw emergency measures, but investors had hoped for a stronger display of support.
articles.lead_paragraph: FRANKFURT  The European Central Bank on Thursday continued its emergency support to weak countries within Europe but stopped short of more aggressive action to contain the debt crisis that has already engulfed Greece and Ireland.
articles.byline: By Jack Ewing and Matthew Saltmarsh
